ai-sn51:1.1.1_0: “Mendicants, when these four bases of psychic power are developed and cultivated they lead to going from the near shore to the far shore.
ai-sn51:1.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by four?
ai-sn51:1.1.3_0: It’s when a mendicant develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to enthusiasm, and active effort.
ai-sn51:1.1.4_0: They develop the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to energy, and active effort.
ai-sn51:1.1.5_0: he cultivates the basis of spiritual power that is concentration of thought accompanied by the volition of striving,
ai-sn51:1.1.6_0: he cultivates the basis of spiritual power that is concentration of investigation accompanied by the volition of striving.
ai-sn51:1.1.7_0: When these four bases of psychic power are developed and cultivated they lead to going from the near shore to the far shore.”
ai-sn51:2.1.1_0: “Mendicants, whoever has missed out on the four bases of psychic power has missed out on the noble path to the complete ending of suffering.
ai-sn51:2.1.2_0: Whoever has undertaken the four bases of psychic power has undertaken the noble path to the complete ending of suffering.
ai-sn51:2.1.3_0: What are the teachings grouped by four?
ai-sn51:2.1.4_0: It’s when a mendicant develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to enthusiasm, and active effort.
ai-sn51:2.1.5_0: He develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to energy ...
ai-sn51:2.1.7_0: he cultivates the basis of spiritual power that is concentration of investigation accompanied by the volition of striving.
ai-sn51:2.1.8_0: Whoever has missed out on these four bases of psychic power has missed out on the noble path to the complete ending of suffering.
ai-sn51:2.1.9_0: Whoever has undertaken these four bases of psychic power has undertaken the noble path to the complete ending of suffering.”
ai-sn51:3.1.1_0: “Mendicants, when these four bases of psychic power are developed and cultivated they are noble and emancipating, and bring one who practices them to the complete ending of suffering.
ai-sn51:3.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by four?
ai-sn51:3.1.3_0: It’s when a mendicant develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to enthusiasm, and active effort.
ai-sn51:3.1.4_0: He develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to energy ...
ai-sn51:3.1.6_0: he cultivates the basis of spiritual power that is concentration of investigation accompanied by the volition of striving.
ai-sn51:3.1.7_0: When these four bases of psychic power are developed and cultivated they are noble and emancipating, and bring one who practices them to the complete ending of suffering.”
ai-sn51:4.1.1_0: “Mendicants, these four bases of psychic power, when developed and cultivated, lead solely to disillusionment, dispassion, cessation, peace, insight, awakening, and extinguishment.
ai-sn51:4.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by four?
ai-sn51:4.1.3_0: It’s when a mendicant develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to enthusiasm, and active effort.
ai-sn51:4.1.4_0: He develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to energy ...
ai-sn51:4.1.6_0: he cultivates the basis of spiritual power that is concentration of investigation accompanied by the volition of striving.
ai-sn51:4.1.7_0: These four bases of psychic power, when developed and cultivated, lead solely to disillusionment, dispassion, cessation, peace, insight, awakening, and extinguishment.”
ai-sn51:5.1.1_0: “Mendicants, all the ascetics and brahmins in the past who have partly manifested psychic powers have done so by developing and cultivating the four bases of psychic power.
ai-sn51:5.1.2_0: All the ascetics and brahmins in the future who will partly manifest psychic powers will do so by developing and cultivating the four bases of psychic power.
ai-sn51:5.1.3_0: All the ascetics and brahmins in the present who are partly manifesting psychic powers do so by developing and cultivating the four bases of psychic power.
ai-sn51:5.2.2_0: It’s when a mendicant develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to enthusiasm, and active effort.
ai-sn51:5.2.3_0: He develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to energy ...
ai-sn51:5.2.5_0: he cultivates the basis of spiritual power that is concentration of investigation accompanied by the volition of striving.
ai-sn51:5.2.6_0: All the ascetics and brahmins in the past who have partly manifested psychic powers have done so by developing and cultivating these four bases of psychic power.
ai-sn51:5.2.7_0: All the ascetics and brahmins in the future who will partly manifest psychic powers will do so by developing and cultivating these four bases of psychic power.
ai-sn51:5.2.8_0: All the ascetics and brahmins in the present who are partly manifesting psychic powers do so by developing and cultivating these four bases of psychic power.”

ai-sn51:6.1.2_0: All the ascetics and brahmins in the future who will completely manifest psychic powers will do so by developing and cultivating the four bases of psychic power.
ai-sn51:6.1.3_0: All the ascetics and brahmins in the present who are completely manifesting psychic powers do so by developing and cultivating the four bases of psychic power.

ai-sn51:6.2.6_0: All the ascetics and brahmins in the past who have completely manifested psychic powers have done so by developing and cultivating these four bases of psychic power.
ai-sn51:6.2.7_0: All the ascetics and brahmins in the future who will completely manifest psychic powers will do so by developing and cultivating these four bases of psychic power.
ai-sn51:6.2.8_0: All the ascetics and brahmins in the present who are completely manifesting psychic powers do so by developing and cultivating these four bases of psychic power.”
ai-sn51:6.2.9_0: The sixth offering to an individual.
ai-sn51:7.1.1_0: “Mendicants, all the mendicants who realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, and live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements, do so by developing and cultivating the four bases of psychic power.
ai-sn51:7.1.2_0: present who realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, and who live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements, do so by developing and cultivating the four bases of psychic power.
ai-sn51:7.1.3_0: present who realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, and who live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements, do so by developing and cultivating the four bases of psychic power.

ai-sn51:7.2.3_0: He develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to energy ...
ai-sn51:7.2.5_0: he cultivates the basis of spiritual power that is concentration of investigation accompanied by the volition of striving.
ai-sn51:7.2.6_0: All the mendicants who realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, and live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements, do so by developing and cultivating these four bases of psychic power.
ai-sn51:7.2.7_0: All the mendicants who realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, and who live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements, do so by developing and cultivating these four bases of psychic power.
ai-sn51:7.2.8_0: present who realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, and who live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements, do so by developing and cultivating these four bases of psychic power.”
ai-sn51:8.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are these four bases of psychic power.
ai-sn51:8.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by four?
ai-sn51:8.1.3_0: It’s when a mendicant develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to enthusiasm, and active effort.
ai-sn51:8.1.4_0: He develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to energy ...
ai-sn51:8.1.6_0: he cultivates the basis of spiritual power that is concentration of investigation accompanied by the volition of striving.
ai-sn51:8.1.7_0: These are the four bases of psychic power.
ai-sn51:8.1.8_0: It is because he has developed and cultivated these four bases of psychic power that the Realized One is called ‘the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha’.”
ai-sn51:9.1.1_0: “Mendicants: ‘This is the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to enthusiasm, and active effort.’ Such was the vision, knowledge, wisdom, realization, and light that arose in me regarding teachings not learned before from another.
ai-sn51:9.1.2_0: ‘This basis of psychic power ... should be developed.’ ...
ai-sn51:9.1.3_0: ‘This basis of psychic power ... has been developed.’ Such was the vision, knowledge, wisdom, realization, and light that arose in me regarding teachings not learned before from another.
ai-sn51:9.2.1_0: ‘This is the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to energy, and active effort.’ ...
ai-sn51:9.2.2_0: ‘This basis of psychic power ... should be developed.’ ...
ai-sn51:9.2.3_0: ‘This basis of psychic power ... has been developed.’ Such was the vision, knowledge, wisdom, realization, and light that arose in me regarding teachings not learned before from another.
ai-sn51:9.3.1_0: ‘This is the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to mental development, and active effort.’ ...
ai-sn51:9.3.2_0: ‘This basis of psychic power ... should be developed.’ ...
ai-sn51:9.3.3_0: ‘This basis of psychic power ... has been developed.’ Such was the vision, knowledge, wisdom, realization, and light that arose in me regarding teachings not learned before from another.
ai-sn51:9.4.1_0: ‘This is the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to inquiry, and active effort.’ ...
ai-sn51:9.4.2_0: ‘This basis of psychic power ... should be developed.’ ...
ai-sn51:9.4.3_0: ‘This basis of psychic power ... has been developed.’ Such was the vision, knowledge, wisdom, realization, and light that arose in me regarding teachings not learned before from another.”
ai-sn51:10.1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Vesālī, at the Great Wood, in the hall with the peaked roof.
ai-sn51:10.1.3_0: Then the Buddha robed up in the morning and, taking his bowl and robe, entered Vesālī for alms.
ai-sn51:10.1.4_0: Then, after the meal, on his return from alms-round, he addressed Venerable Ānanda,
ai-sn51:10.1.6_0: Let’s go to the Cāpāla shrine for the day’s meditation.”
ai-sn51:10.1.7_0: “Yes, sir,” replied Ānanda. Taking his sitting cloth he followed behind the Buddha.
ai-sn51:10.2.1_0: Then the Buddha went up to the Cāpāla shrine, where he sat on the seat spread out.
ai-sn51:10.2.2_0: Ānanda bowed to the Buddha and sat down to one side.
ai-sn51:10.3.1_0: “Ānanda, Vesālī is lovely. And the Udena, Gotamaka, Sattamba, Bahuputta, Sārandada, and Cāpāla shrines are all lovely.
ai-sn51:10.3.2_0: Whoever has developed and cultivated the four bases of psychic power—made them a vehicle and a basis, kept them up, consolidated them, and properly implemented them—may, if they wish, live on for the eon, or what’s left of it.
ai-sn51:10.3.3_0: The Realized One has developed and cultivated the four bases of psychic power, made them a vehicle and a basis, kept them up, consolidated them, and properly implemented them. If he wished, the Realized One could live on for the eon or what’s left of the eon.”
ai-sn51:10.3.3_1: If he wished, the Realized One could live on for the eon or what’s left of the eon.”
ai-sn51:10.4.1_0: But Ānanda didn’t get it, even though the Buddha dropped such an obvious hint, such a clear sign.
ai-sn51:10.4.3_0: “Sir, may the Blessed One please remain for the eon! May the Holy One please remain for the eon! That would be for the welfare and happiness of the people, for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of gods and humans.” For his mind was as if possessed by Māra.
ai-sn51:10.5.2_0: And for a third time, the Buddha said to Ānanda:
ai-sn51:10.5.3_0: “Ānanda, Vesālī is lovely. And the Udena, Gotamaka, Sattamba, Bahuputta, Sārandada, and Cāpāla shrines are all lovely.
ai-sn51:10.5.4_0: Whoever has developed and cultivated the four bases of psychic power—made them a vehicle and a basis, kept them up, consolidated them, and properly implemented them—may, if they wish, live on for the eon, or what’s left of it.
ai-sn51:10.5.5_0: The Realized One has developed and cultivated the four bases of psychic power, made them a vehicle and a basis, kept them up, consolidated them, and properly implemented them. If he wished, the Realized One could live on for the eon or what’s left of the eon.”
ai-sn51:10.5.5_1: If he wished, the Realized One could live on for the eon or what’s left of the eon.”
ai-sn51:10.6.1_0: But Ānanda didn’t get it, even though the Buddha dropped such an obvious hint, such a clear sign.
ai-sn51:10.6.3_0: “Sir, may the Blessed One please remain for the eon! May the Holy One please remain for the eon! That would be for the welfare and happiness of the people, for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of gods and humans.” For his mind was as if possessed by Māra.
ai-sn51:10.7.1_0: Then the Buddha said to Venerable Ānanda,
ai-sn51:10.8.1_0: Then Māra the Wicked, not long after Ānanda had left, went to the Fortunate One,
ai-sn51:10.8.1_1: and after going, he said this to the Fortunate One:
ai-sn51:10.9.1_0: “May the Fortunate One attain Final Emancipation now, reverend Sir, may the Happy One attain Final Emancipation,
ai-sn51:10.9.1_1: now is the time, reverend Sir, for the Fortunate One’s Final Emancipation.
ai-sn51:10.9.2_0: Sir, you once made this statement:
ai-sn51:10.9.3_0: ‘Wicked One, I will not become fully extinguished until I have monk disciples ...
ai-sn51:10.10.1_0: Today you do have such monk disciples.
ai-sn51:10.10.2_0: May the Fortunate One attain Final Emancipation now, reverend Sir, may the Happy One attain Final Emancipation,
ai-sn51:10.10.2_1: now is the time, reverend Sir, for the Fortunate One’s Final Emancipation.
ai-sn51:10.11.1_0: Sir, you once made this statement:
ai-sn51:10.11.2_0: ‘Wicked One, I will not become fully extinguished until I have nun disciples who are competent, educated, assured, learned ...’
ai-sn51:10.12.1_0: Today you do have such nun disciples.
ai-sn51:10.12.2_0: May the Fortunate One attain Final Emancipation now, reverend Sir, may the Happy One attain Final Emancipation,
ai-sn51:10.12.2_1: now is the time, reverend Sir, for the Fortunate One’s Final Emancipation.
ai-sn51:10.13.1_0: Sir, you once made this statement:
ai-sn51:10.13.2_0: ‘Wicked One, I will not become fully extinguished until I have layman disciples ...
ai-sn51:10.13.3_0: and laywoman disciples who are competent, educated, assured, learned ...’ ...
ai-sn51:10.14.3_0: May the Fortunate One attain Final Emancipation now, reverend Sir, may the Happy One attain Final Emancipation,
ai-sn51:10.14.3_1: now is the time, reverend Sir, for the Fortunate One’s Final Emancipation.
ai-sn51:10.15.1_0: Sir, you once made this statement:
ai-sn51:10.15.2_0: Not until my spiritual life is successful and prosperous, extensive, popular, widespread, and well proclaimed wherever there are gods and humans.’
ai-sn51:10.15.3_0: And that’s how this spiritual life has become successful and prosperous, extensive, popular, widespread, and well proclaimed wherever there are gods and humans.
ai-sn51:10.15.4_0: May the Fortunate One attain Final Emancipation now, reverend Sir, may the Happy One attain Final Emancipation,
ai-sn51:10.16.1_0: When this was said, the Buddha said to Māra,
ai-sn51:10.16.2_0: “Relax, Wicked One. The final extinguishment of the Realized One will be soon.
ai-sn51:10.16.3_0: Three months from now the Realized One will finally be extinguished.”
ai-sn51:10.17.1_0: Then at the Cāpāla shrine the Fortunate One, mindfully, with full awareness, relinquished the life-process.
ai-sn51:10.17.2_0: When he did so there was a great earthquake, awe-inspiring and hair-raising, and thunder cracked the sky.
ai-sn51:10.17.3_0: Then, knowing the significance of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ai-sn51:10.18.2_0: And the continuation-process the Sage relinquished.
ai-sn51:10.18.4_0: He broke continuity of self like a coat of mail.”
ai-sn51:10.18.6_0: The first sub-chapter on Cāpāla is finished.
ai-sn51:10.19.3_0: The training rule on which is complete.
ai-sn51:11.1.2_0: “Mendicants, before my awakening—when I was still unawakened but intent on awakening—I thought:
ai-sn51:11.1.3_0: ‘What’s the cause, what’s the reason for the development of the bases of psychic power?’
ai-sn51:11.1.5_0: ‘It’s when a mendicant develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to enthusiasm, and active effort.
ai-sn51:11.1.6_0: They think: ‘My enthusiasm won’t be too lax or too tense. And it’ll be neither constricted internally nor scattered externally.’
ai-sn51:11.1.8_0: as before, so after; as after, so before.
ai-sn51:11.1.9_0: as below, so above; as above, so below;
ai-sn51:11.1.10_0: as by day, so by night; as by night, so by day.
ai-sn51:11.1.11_0: And so, with an open and unenveloped heart, they develop a mind that’s full of radiance.
ai-sn51:11.2.1_0: They develop the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to energy, and active effort.
ai-sn51:11.2.2_0: They think: ‘My energy won’t be too lax or too tense. And it’ll be neither constricted internally nor scattered externally.’

ai-sn51:11.5.1_0: When the four bases of psychic power have been developed and cultivated in this way, a mendicant wields the many kinds of psychic power:
ai-sn51:11.5.1_2: Outside the walls, (wholes) go through the sky. It is like the sky.
ai-sn51:11.5.1_3: They emerge from the earth and water, like the water in the sky.
ai-sn51:11.5.1_4: As if they consum it into the water, it’s like the earth.
ai-sn51:11.5.1_5: And the air that lumps the sky.
ai-sn51:11.5.1_6: And in the Moon and the Sun, whose hand and feet does so mighty and powerful,
ai-sn51:11.5.1_7: he exercises power as far as the Brahma worlds with his body.
ai-sn51:11.6.1_0: When the four bases of psychic power have been developed and cultivated in this way, they hear both kinds of sounds, human and divine, whether near or far.
ai-sn51:11.7.1_0: When the four bases of psychic power have been developed and cultivated in this way, they understand the minds of other beings and individuals, having comprehended them with their own mind.
ai-sn51:11.7.2_0: mind with greed as ‘mind with greed’,
ai-sn51:11.7.3_0: and mind without greed as ‘mind without greed’.
ai-sn51:11.7.8_0: They know constricted mind as ‘constricted mind,’
ai-sn51:11.7.14_0: mind immersed in samādhi as ‘mind immersed in samādhi,’
ai-sn51:11.7.15_0: and mind not immersed in samādhi as ‘mind not immersed in samādhi.’
ai-sn51:11.7.17_0: They understand unfreed mind as ‘unfreed mind’.
ai-sn51:11.8.1_0: When the four bases of psychic power have been developed and cultivated in this way, they recollect many kinds of past lives. That is:
ai-sn51:11.8.1_1: one, two, three, four, five, ten, twenty, thirty, forty, fifty, a hundred, a thousand, a hundred thousand rebirths.
ai-sn51:11.8.1_2: They remember: ‘There, I was named this, my clan was that, I looked like this, and that was my food.
ai-sn51:11.8.1_3: They remember: ‘There, I was named this, my clan was that, I looked like this, and that was my food. This was how I felt pleasure and pain, and that was how my life ended. When I passed away from that place I was reborn somewhere else. There, too, I was named this, my clan was that, I looked like this, and that was my food. This was how I felt pleasure and pain, and that was how my life ended. When I passed away from that place I was reborn here.’ And so they recollect their many kinds of past lives, with features and details.
ai-sn51:11.9.1_0: When the four bases of psychic power have been developed and cultivated in this way, with clairvoyance that is purified and superhuman, they see sentient beings passing away and being reborn—inferior and superior, beautiful and ugly, in a good place or a bad place. They understand how sentient beings are reborn according to their deeds.
ai-sn51:11.9.1_1: ‘These dear beings did bad things by way of body, speech, and mind.
ai-sn51:11.9.1_2: They spoke ill of the noble ones; they had wrong view; and they chose to act out of that wrong view.
ai-sn51:11.9.1_3: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.
ai-sn51:11.9.1_4: at the breaking up of the body after death, have been reborn in a good destination, a heaven world.’
ai-sn51:11.9.1_5: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell. These dear beings, however, did good things by way of body, speech, and mind. They never spoke ill of the noble ones; they had right view; and they chose to act out of that right view. When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.’ And so, with clairvoyance that is purified and superhuman, they see sentient beings passing away and being reborn—inferior and superior, beautiful and ugly, in a good place or a bad place. They understand how sentient beings are reborn according to their deeds.
ai-sn51:11.10.1_0: When the four bases of psychic power have been developed and cultivated in this way, they realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. And they live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.”
ai-sn51:12.1.1_0: “Mendicants, when the four bases of psychic power are developed and cultivated they’re very fruitful and beneficial.
ai-sn51:12.1.2_0: And how are the four bases of psychic power developed and cultivated to be very fruitful and beneficial?
ai-sn51:12.1.3_0: It’s when a mendicant develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to enthusiasm, and active effort.
ai-sn51:12.1.4_0: They think: ‘My enthusiasm won’t be too lax or too tense. And it’ll be neither constricted internally nor scattered externally.’
ai-sn51:12.1.6_0: as before, so after; as after, so before.
ai-sn51:12.1.7_0: as below, so above; as above, so below;
ai-sn51:12.1.8_0: as by day, so by night; as by night, so by day.
ai-sn51:12.1.9_0: And so, with an open and unenveloped heart, they develop a mind that’s full of radiance.

ai-sn51:12.2.4_0: He thinks: ‘My inquiry won’t be too lax or too tense. And it’ll be neither constricted internally nor scattered externally.’

ai-sn51:12.2.8_0: as by day, so by night; as by night, so by day.
ai-sn51:12.2.9_0: And so, with an open and unenveloped heart, they develop a mind that’s full of radiance.
ai-sn51:12.2.10_0: When the four bases of psychic power have been developed and cultivated in this way they’re very fruitful and beneficial.
ai-sn51:12.3.1_0: When the four bases of psychic power have been developed and cultivated in this way, a mendicant wields the many kinds of psychic power: multiplying themselves and becoming one again ...
ai-sn51:12.3.1_1: he controls the body as far as the Brahmā realm. ...
ai-sn51:12.4.1_0: When the four bases of psychic power have been developed and cultivated in this way, they realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. And they live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.”
ai-sn51:13.1.1_0: “Mendicants, if a mendicant depends on enthusiasm in order to gain immersion, gain unification of mind,
ai-sn51:13.1.2_0: this is called immersion due to enthusiasm.
ai-sn51:13.1.3_0: They generate enthusiasm, try, make an effort, exert the mind, and strive so that bad, unskillful qualities don’t arise.
ai-sn51:13.1.4_0: They generate enthusiasm, try, make an effort, exert the mind, and strive so that bad, unskillful qualities that have arisen are given up.
ai-sn51:13.1.5_0: They generate enthusiasm, try, make an effort, exert the mind, and strive so that skillful qualities that have not arisen do arise.
ai-sn51:13.1.6_0: so that skillful qualities that have arisen remain, are not lost, but increase, mature, and are completed by development.
ai-sn51:13.1.8_0: And so there is enthusiasm, effort, zeal, vigor, perseverance, and these active efforts.
ai-sn51:13.1.9_0: This is called the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to enthusiasm, and active effort.
ai-sn51:13.2.1_0: If a mendicant depends on energy in order to gain immersion, gain unification of mind,
ai-sn51:13.2.2_0: this is called immersion due to energy.
ai-sn51:13.2.3_0: They generate enthusiasm, try, make an effort, exert the mind, and strive so that bad, unskillful qualities don’t arise ...
ai-sn51:13.2.4_0: so that skillful qualities that have arisen remain, are not lost, but increase, mature, and are completed by development.
ai-sn51:13.2.6_0: And so there is this energy, this immersion due to energy, and these active efforts.
ai-sn51:13.2.7_0: This is called the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to energy.
ai-sn51:13.3.1_0: If a mendicant depends on mental development in order to gain immersion, gain unification of mind,
ai-sn51:13.3.2_0: this is called immersion due to mental development.
ai-sn51:13.3.3_0: They generate enthusiasm, try, make an effort, exert the mind, and strive so that bad, unskillful qualities don’t arise ...
ai-sn51:13.3.4_0: so that skillful qualities that have arisen remain, are not lost, but increase, mature, and are completed by development.
ai-sn51:13.3.6_0: And so there is this mental development, this immersion due to mental development, and these active efforts.
ai-sn51:13.3.7_0: This is called the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to mental development, and active effort.
ai-sn51:13.4.1_0: If a mendicant depends on inquiry in order to gain immersion, gain unification of mind,
ai-sn51:13.4.2_0: this is called immersion due to inquiry.
ai-sn51:13.4.3_0: They generate enthusiasm, try, make an effort, exert the mind, and strive so that bad, unskillful qualities don’t arise ...
ai-sn51:13.4.4_0: so that skillful qualities that have arisen remain, are not lost, but increase, mature, and are completed by development.
ai-sn51:13.4.6_0: And so there is this inquiry, this immersion due to inquiry, and these active efforts.
ai-sn51:13.4.7_0: This is called the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to inquiry, and active effort.”
ai-sn51:14.1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in the Eastern Monastery, the stilt longhouse of Migāra’s mother.
ai-sn51:14.1.3_0: Now at that time several mendicants were staying beneath the longhouse. They were restless, insolent, fickle, scurrilous, loose-tongued, unmindful, lacking situational awareness and immersion, with straying minds and undisciplined faculties.
ai-sn51:14.2.1_0: Then the Buddha addressed Venerable Mahāmoggallāna,
ai-sn51:14.2.2_0: “These spiritual companions of yours staying beneath the longhouse are restless, insolent, fickle, scurrilous, loose-tongued, unmindful, lacking situational awareness and immersion, with wandering mind and undisciplined faculties.
ai-sn51:14.2.3_0: Go, Moggallāna, and strike awe in those mendicants!”
ai-sn51:14.3.1_0: “Yes, sir,” replied Mahāmoggallāna. He did as he was asked, then shake off his big toe.
ai-sn51:14.3.2_0: Then those mendicants stood to one side, shocked and awestruck.
ai-sn51:14.3.4_0: immoral, attractive, profound, shake, and rock and tremble.”
ai-sn51:14.4.1_0: Then the Buddha went up to those mendicants and said:
ai-sn51:14.4.2_0: “Why do you, mendicants, stand to one side, shocked and awestruck?”
ai-sn51:14.4.4_0: immoral, attractive, profound, shake, and rock and tremble.”
ai-sn51:14.4.5_0: “Wanting to strike awe in you, the mendicant Moggallāna made the longhouse shake and rock and tremble with his toe.
ai-sn51:14.4.7_0: What things has the mendicant Moggallāna developed and cultivated so as to have such power and might?”
ai-sn51:14.4.8_0: “Our teachings are rooted in the Buddha.
ai-sn51:14.4.8_1: He is our guide and our refuge.
ai-sn51:14.4.8_2: The mendicants will listen and remember it.”
ai-sn51:14.5.1_0: “Well then, monks, listen to the teachings.
ai-sn51:14.5.2_0: The mendicant Moggallāna has become so powerful and mighty by developing and cultivating the four bases of psychic power.
ai-sn51:14.5.4_0: Moggallāna develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to enthusiasm ...
ai-sn51:14.5.5_0: He develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to energy ...
ai-sn51:14.5.8_0: He thinks: ‘My inquiry won’t be too lax or too tense.’
ai-sn51:14.5.9_0: he does not constricted internally, nor scattered externally;
ai-sn51:14.5.11_0: as before, so after; as after, so before.
ai-sn51:14.5.12_0: as below, so above; as above, so below;
ai-sn51:14.5.13_0: as by day, so by night; as by night, so by day.
ai-sn51:14.5.14_0: And so, with an open and unenveloped heart, they develop a mind that’s full of radiance.
ai-sn51:14.5.15_0: The mendicant Moggallāna has become so powerful and mighty by developing and cultivating these four bases of psychic power.
ai-sn51:14.5.16_0: And by developing and cultivating these four bases of psychic power, the mendicant Moggallāna wields the many kinds of psychic power. ...
ai-sn51:14.5.16_1: he controls the body as far as the Brahmā realm. ...
ai-sn51:14.5.17_0: And by developing and cultivating these four bases of psychic power, the mendicant Moggallāna realizes the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. And he lives having realized it with his own insight due to the ending of defilements.”
ai-sn51:15.1.2_0: At one time Venerable Ānanda was staying near Kosambi, in Ghosita’s Monastery.
ai-sn51:15.1.3_0: Then Uṇṇābha the brahmin went to Venerable Ānanda,
ai-sn51:15.1.3_1: and after approaching he exchanged greetings with venerable Ānanda,
ai-sn51:15.1.4_0: and after exchanging courteous talk and greetings, he sat down on one side.
ai-sn51:15.1.5_0: “Master Ānanda, what’s the purpose of leading the spiritual life under the ascetic Gotama?”
ai-sn51:15.1.6_0: “The purpose of leading the spiritual life under the Buddha, brahmin, is to give up desire.”
ai-sn51:15.2.1_0: “But is there a path and a practice for giving up that desire?”
ai-sn51:15.3.2_0: “It’s when a mendicant develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to enthusiasm ...
ai-sn51:15.3.3_0: He develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to energy ...
ai-sn51:15.3.6_0: This is the path and the practice for giving up that desire.”
ai-sn51:15.4.1_0: “This being the case, Master Ānanda, the path is endless, not finite.
ai-sn51:15.4.2_0: For it’s not possible to give up desire by means of desire.”
ai-sn51:15.4.3_0: “Well then, brahmin, I’ll ask you about this in return, and you can answer as you like.
ai-sn51:15.4.5_0: Have you ever had a desire to walk to the park,
ai-sn51:15.4.6_0: but when you arrived at the park, the corresponding desire faded away?”
ai-sn51:15.4.8_0: “Have you ever had energy to walk to the park,
ai-sn51:15.4.9_0: but when you arrived at the park, the corresponding energy is roused up.”
ai-sn51:15.4.11_0: “Have you ever had the idea to walk to the park,
ai-sn51:15.4.12_0: but when you arrived at the park, the corresponding idea faded away?”
ai-sn51:15.4.14_0: “Have you ever inquired regarding a walk to the park,
ai-sn51:15.4.15_0: but when you arrived at the park, the corresponding inquiry faded away?”
ai-sn51:15.5.1_0: “In the same way, take a mendicant who is perfected—with defilements ended, who has completed the spiritual journey, done what had to be done, laid down the burden, achieved their own true goal, utterly ended the fetters of rebirth, and is rightly freed through enlightenment. They formerly had the desire to attain perfection, but when they attained perfection the corresponding desire faded away.
ai-sn51:15.5.2_0: They formerly had the energy to attain perfection, but when they attained perfection the corresponding energy faded away.
ai-sn51:15.5.3_0: They formerly had the idea to attain perfection, but when they attained perfection the corresponding idea faded away.
ai-sn51:15.5.4_0: They formerly inquired regarding attaining perfection, but when they attained perfection the corresponding inquiry faded away.
ai-sn51:15.5.6_0: This being the case, is the path endless or finite?”
ai-sn51:15.6.1_0: “Clearly, Master Ānanda, this being the case, the path is finite, not endless.
ai-sn51:15.6.3_0: Just as one might set upright what had been overturned, or reveal what was hidden, or show the way to one who was lost, or bring a lamp into the darkness so that
ai-sn51:15.6.3_1: so that one with eyes might see what’s there—
ai-sn51:15.6.3_2: just so have you made the Teaching clear in many ways.
ai-sn51:15.6.4_0: I go for refuge to Master Gotama, to the teaching, and to the mendicant Saṅgha.
ai-sn51:15.6.5_0: From this day forth, may Master Ānanda remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”
ai-sn51:16.1.1_0: “Mendicants, all the ascetics and brahmins in the past,
ai-sn51:16.1.2_0: All the ascetics and brahmins in the future who will have become so by developing and cultivating the four bases of psychic power.
ai-sn51:16.1.3_0: or present who are mighty and powerful have become so by developing and cultivating the four bases of psychic power.
ai-sn51:16.2.2_0: It’s when a mendicant develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to enthusiasm, and active effort.
ai-sn51:16.2.3_0: He develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to energy ...
ai-sn51:16.2.5_0: he cultivates the basis of spiritual power that is concentration of investigation accompanied by the volition of striving.
ai-sn51:16.2.6_0: All the ascetics and brahmins in the past,
ai-sn51:16.2.7_0: All the ascetics and brahmins in the future who will be so by developing and cultivating these four bases of psychic power.
ai-sn51:16.2.8_0: or present who are mighty and powerful have become so by developing and cultivating these four bases of psychic power.”
ai-sn51:16.2.9_0: The sixth offering to an individual.
ai-sn51:17.1.1_0: “Mendicants, all the ascetics and brahmins in the past,
ai-sn51:17.1.1_2: Outside the walls, (wholes) came through the air, as though he were unbeneficial mountain.
ai-sn51:17.1.1_3: They emerge from the earth and water, like the water in the sky.
ai-sn51:17.1.1_4: Both in the water, like the earth.
ai-sn51:17.1.1_5: And a bird with wings were as though the sky.
ai-sn51:17.1.1_6: And these moon and sun were so powerful, so mighty and powerful, they bigged and powerful.
ai-sn51:17.1.2_0: do so by developing and cultivating the four bases of psychic power.
ai-sn51:17.2.1_0: All the ascetics and brahmins in the future who will wield the many kinds of psychic power:
ai-sn51:17.2.1_2: Outside the walls, (wholesome) will walk in the sky.
ai-sn51:17.2.1_3: They’ll dive into the earth, like the water-pot.
ai-sn51:17.2.1_4: They’ll travel in water, like the earth.
ai-sn51:17.2.1_5: Walking into the air, like a bird with wings;
ai-sn51:17.2.1_6: even the stars of the moon and sun, so mighty and powerful, they will fulfill all.
ai-sn51:17.2.1_7: even as far as the Brahmā realm,
ai-sn51:17.2.2_0: do so by developing and cultivating the four bases of psychic power.
ai-sn51:17.3.1_0: or present who wield the many kinds of psychic power—multiplying themselves and becoming one again,
ai-sn51:17.3.1_2: Outside the walls, (wholes) go through the sky, as though the sun (becames),
ai-sn51:17.3.1_3: They emerge from the earth and water, like the water in the sky.
ai-sn51:17.3.1_5: And as a sewer heat crossed over the sky.
ai-sn51:17.3.1_6: And these moon and sun, so mighty and powerful, they majestic.
ai-sn51:17.3.1_7: People control the body as far as the Brahmā realm.
ai-sn51:17.3.2_0: do so by developing and cultivating the four bases of psychic power.
ai-sn51:17.4.2_0: It’s when a mendicant develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to enthusiasm, and active effort.
ai-sn51:17.4.3_0: He develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to energy ...
ai-sn51:17.4.5_0: he cultivates the basis of spiritual power that is concentration of investigation accompanied by the volition of striving.
ai-sn51:17.4.6_0: Mendicants, all the ascetics and brahmins in the past,
ai-sn51:17.4.7_0: do so by developing and cultivating these four bases of psychic power.
ai-sn51:17.5.1_0: Any ascetics and brahmins in the future ...
ai-sn51:17.5.1_1: even as far as the Brahmā realm,
ai-sn51:17.5.2_0: do so by developing and cultivating these four bases of psychic power.
ai-sn51:17.6.1_0: or present who wield the many kinds of psychic power—
ai-sn51:17.6.1_1: People control the body as far as the Brahmā realm.
ai-sn51:17.6.2_0: do so by developing and cultivating these four bases of psychic power.”
ai-sn51:18.1.1_0: “Mendicants, by developing and cultivating the four bases of psychic power, a mendicant realizes the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. And they live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.
ai-sn51:18.2.2_0: It’s when a mendicant develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to enthusiasm, and active effort.
ai-sn51:18.2.3_0: He develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to energy ...
ai-sn51:18.2.5_0: he cultivates the basis of spiritual power that is concentration of investigation accompanied by the volition of striving.
ai-sn51:18.2.6_0: It’s because of developing and cultivating these four bases of psychic power that a mendicant realizes the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. And they live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.”
ai-sn51:19.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I will teach you psychic power, the bases of psychic power, the development of the bases of psychic power, and the practice that leads to the development of the bases of psychic power.
ai-sn51:19.2.2_0: It’s when a mendicant wields the many kinds of psychic power: multiplying themselves and becoming one again ...
ai-sn51:19.2.2_1: By means of the Brahmā realm, saying,
ai-sn51:19.3.1_0: And what is the basis of psychic power?
ai-sn51:19.3.2_0: The path and practice that leads to gaining psychic power.
ai-sn51:19.3.3_0: This is called the basis of psychic power.
ai-sn51:19.4.1_0: And what is the development of the bases of psychic power?
ai-sn51:19.4.2_0: It’s when a mendicant develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to enthusiasm, and active effort.
ai-sn51:19.4.3_0: He develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to energy ...
ai-sn51:19.4.6_0: This is called the development of the bases of psychic power.
ai-sn51:19.5.1_0: And what is the practice that leads to the development of the bases of psychic power?
ai-sn51:19.5.3_0: right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right immersion.
ai-sn51:19.5.4_0: This is called the practice that leads to the development of the bases of psychic power.”
ai-sn51:20.1.1_0: “Mendicants, when the four bases of psychic power are developed and cultivated they’re very fruitful and beneficial.
ai-sn51:20.2.1_0: And how are the four bases of psychic power developed and cultivated to be very fruitful and beneficial?
ai-sn51:20.2.2_0: It’s when a mendicant develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to enthusiasm, and active effort.
ai-sn51:20.2.3_0: They think: ‘My enthusiasm won’t be too lax or too tense. And it’ll be neither constricted internally nor scattered externally.’
ai-sn51:20.2.5_0: as before, so after; as after, so before.
ai-sn51:20.2.6_0: as below, so above; as above, so below;
ai-sn51:20.2.7_0: as by day, so by night; as by night, so by day.
ai-sn51:20.2.8_0: And so, with an open and unenveloped heart, they develop a mind that’s full of radiance.
ai-sn51:20.2.9_0: He develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to energy ...
ai-sn51:20.2.12_0: He thinks: ‘My inquiry won’t be too lax or too tense. And it’ll be neither constricted internally nor scattered externally.’
ai-sn51:20.2.14_0: as before, so after; as after, so before.
ai-sn51:20.2.15_0: as below, so above; as above, so below;
ai-sn51:20.2.16_0: as by day, so by night; as by night, so by day.
ai-sn51:20.2.17_0: And so, with an open and unenveloped heart, they develop a mind that’s full of radiance.
ai-sn51:20.3.1_0: And what is enthusiasm that’s too lax?
ai-sn51:20.3.2_0: It’s when enthusiasm is combined with laziness.
ai-sn51:20.4.1_0: And what is enthusiasm that’s too tense?
ai-sn51:20.4.2_0: It’s when enthusiasm is combined with restlessness.
ai-sn51:20.5.1_0: And what is enthusiasm constricted internally?
ai-sn51:20.5.2_0: It’s when enthusiasm is combined with dullness and drowsiness.
ai-sn51:20.5.3_0: This is called enthusiasm constricted internally.
ai-sn51:20.6.1_0: And what is enthusiasm that’s dispensation?
ai-sn51:20.6.2_0: It’s when enthusiasm is frequently distracted and diffused externally on account of the five kinds of sensual stimulation.
ai-sn51:20.7.1_0: And how does a mendicant meditate perceiving continuity:
ai-sn51:20.7.2_0: as before, so after; as after, so before.
ai-sn51:20.7.3_0: It’s when a mendicant has properly grasped, attended, borne in mind, and comprehended with wisdom.
ai-sn51:20.7.4_0: That’s how a mendicant meditates perceiving continuity:
ai-sn51:20.7.5_0: as before, so after; as after, so before.
ai-sn51:20.8.1_0: And how does a mendicant meditate as below, so above; as above, so below?
ai-sn51:20.8.2_0: It’s when a mendicant examines their own body up from the soles of the feet and down from the tips of the hairs, wrapped in skin and full of many kinds of filth.
ai-sn51:20.8.3_0: ‘In this body there is head hair, body hair, nails, teeth, skin, flesh, sinews, bones, bone marrow, kidneys, heart, liver, diaphragm, spleen, lungs, intestines, mesentery, undigested food, feces, bile, phlegm, pus, blood, sweat, fat, tears, grease, saliva, snot, synovial fluid, urine.’
ai-sn51:20.8.4_0: That’s how a mendicant meditates as below, so above; as above, so below.
ai-sn51:20.9.1_0: And how does a mendicant meditate as by day, so by night; as by night, so by day?
ai-sn51:20.9.2_0: It’s when a mendicant develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to enthusiasm, and active effort, with the same features, attributes, and signs by day as by night.
ai-sn51:20.9.3_0: And they develop it with the same features, attributes, and signs by night as by day.
ai-sn51:20.9.4_0: That’s how a mendicant meditates as by day, so by night; as by night, so by day.
ai-sn51:20.10.1_0: And how, with an open and unenveloped heart, does a mendicant develop a mind that’s full of radiance?
ai-sn51:20.10.2_0: It’s when a mendicant has properly grasped the perception of light, and has properly grasped the perception of day.
ai-sn51:20.10.3_0: That’s how, with an open and unenveloped heart, a mendicant develops a mind that’s full of radiance.
ai-sn51:20.11.1_0: And what is energy that’s too lax? ...
ai-sn51:20.11.2_0: That energy associated with laziness associated with laziness.
ai-sn51:20.12.3_0: This is called the unstressive energy.
ai-sn51:20.13.2_0: The energy that’s associated with dullness and drowsiness is associated with dullness and drowsiness.
ai-sn51:20.13.3_0: This is called the energy constricted internally.
ai-sn51:20.14.2_0: Any energy that’s called ‘mindfulness of sensual pleasures’. ...
ai-sn51:20.15.1_0: And how, with an open and unenveloped heart, does a mendicant develop a mind that’s full of radiance?
ai-sn51:20.15.2_0: It’s when a mendicant has properly grasped the perception of light, and has properly grasped the perception of day.
ai-sn51:20.15.3_0: That’s how, with an open and unenveloped heart, a mendicant develops a mind that’s full of radiance.
ai-sn51:20.16.1_0: And what is mental development that’s too lax? ...
ai-sn51:20.17.1_0: And what is the undeveloped mind?
ai-sn51:20.17.2_0: An restless mind associated with a restless mind;
ai-sn51:20.17.3_0: This is called the undeveloped mind.
ai-sn51:20.18.1_0: And what is the mind constricted internally?
ai-sn51:20.18.3_0: This is called the mind constricted internally.
ai-sn51:20.19.1_0: And what is the mind scattered externally?
ai-sn51:20.19.2_0: Their mind is distracted and diffused externally on account of the five kinds of sensual stimulation.
ai-sn51:20.19.3_0: This is called the scattered mind.
ai-sn51:20.19.4_0: That’s how, with an open and unenveloped heart, a mendicant develops a mind that’s full of radiance.
ai-sn51:20.20.1_0: And what is inquiry that’s too lax?
ai-sn51:20.20.2_0: It’s when inquiry is combined with laziness.
ai-sn51:20.20.3_0: This is called too lax inquiry.
ai-sn51:20.21.1_0: And what is inquiry that’s too tense?
ai-sn51:20.21.2_0: It’s when inquiry is combined with restlessness.
ai-sn51:20.22.1_0: And what is inquiry that’s constricted internally?
ai-sn51:20.22.2_0: It’s when inquiry is combined with dullness and drowsiness.
ai-sn51:20.22.3_0: This is called inquiry constricted internally.
ai-sn51:20.23.1_0: And what is inquiry that’s distracted externally?
ai-sn51:20.23.2_0: It’s when inquiry is frequently distracted and diffused externally on account of the five kinds of sensual stimulation.
ai-sn51:20.23.3_0: This is called inquiry distracted externally. ...
ai-sn51:20.23.4_0: That’s how, with an open and unenveloped heart, a mendicant develops a mind that’s full of radiance.
ai-sn51:20.23.5_0: When the four bases of psychic power have been developed and cultivated in this way they’re very fruitful and beneficial.
ai-sn51:20.24.1_0: When the four bases of psychic power have been developed and cultivated in this way, a mendicant wields the many kinds of psychic power: multiplying themselves and becoming one again ...
ai-sn51:20.24.1_1: he exercises power as far as the Brahma worlds with his body.
ai-sn51:20.24.2_0: When the four bases of psychic power have been developed and cultivated in this way, they realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. And they live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.”
ai-sn51:20.24.4_0: The second sub-chapter on stilt houses is finished.
ai-sn51:21.1.2_0: “Mendicants, before my awakening—when I was still unawakened but intent on awakening—I thought:
ai-sn51:21.1.3_0: ‘What’s the path and practice for developing the bases of psychic power?’
ai-sn51:21.1.5_0: ‘It’s when a mendicant develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to enthusiasm, and active effort.
ai-sn51:21.1.6_0: They think: ‘My enthusiasm won’t be too lax or too tense. And it’ll be neither constricted internally nor scattered externally.’
ai-sn51:21.1.8_0: as before, so after; as after, so before.
ai-sn51:21.1.9_0: as below, so above; as above, so below;
ai-sn51:21.1.10_0: as by day, so by night; as by night, so by day.
ai-sn51:21.1.11_0: And so, with an open and unenveloped heart, they develop a mind that’s full of radiance.
ai-sn51:21.1.12_0: He develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to energy ...
ai-sn51:21.1.15_0: He thinks: ‘My inquiry won’t be too lax or too tense. And it’ll be neither constricted internally nor scattered externally.’
ai-sn51:21.1.17_0: as before, so after; as after, so before.
ai-sn51:21.1.18_0: as below, so above; as above, so below;
ai-sn51:21.1.19_0: as by day, so by night; as by night, so by day.
ai-sn51:21.1.20_0: And so, with an open and unenveloped heart, they develop a mind that’s full of radiance.
ai-sn51:21.2.1_0: When the four bases of psychic power have been developed and cultivated in this way, a mendicant wields the many kinds of psychic power: multiplying themselves and becoming one again ...
ai-sn51:21.2.1_1: he exercises power as far as the Brahma worlds with his body.
ai-sn51:21.2.2_0: When the four bases of psychic power have been developed and cultivated in this way, they realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. And they live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.”
ai-sn51:21.2.4_0: ‘With clairaudience that is purified and superhuman, may I hear both kinds of sounds, human and divine, whether near or far.’ ...
ai-sn51:22.1.2_0: Then Venerable Ānanda went up to the Buddha,
ai-sn51:22.1.2_2: After the meal, on his return from alms-round, he went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and told him what had happened.
ai-sn51:22.1.3_0: “Sir, do you have personal experience of going to the Brahmā realm by psychic power with a mind-made body?”
ai-sn51:22.1.5_0: “But do you have personal experience of going to the Brahmā realm by psychic power with this body made up of the four primary elements?”
ai-sn51:22.2.1_0: “It’s incredible and amazing that the Buddha is capable of going to the Brahmā realm by psychic power with a mind-made body! And that he has personal experience of going to the Brahmā realm by psychic power with this body made up of the four primary elements!”
ai-sn51:22.2.2_0: “The Realized Ones are incredible, Ānanda, and they have incredible qualities.
ai-sn51:22.3.1_0: When the Realized One submerges his body in his mind and his mind in his body. He meditates after sinking into a perception of bliss and lightness in the body.
ai-sn51:22.3.2_0: At that time his body becomes lighter, softer, more workable, and more radiant.
ai-sn51:22.4.1_0: Suppose there was an iron ball that had been heated all day. It’d become lighter, softer, more workable, and more radiant.
ai-sn51:22.4.2_0: In the same way, sometimes the Realized One submerges his body in his mind and his mind in his body. He meditates after sinking into a perception of bliss and lightness in the body.
ai-sn51:22.4.3_0: At that time his body becomes lighter, softer, more workable, and more radiant.
ai-sn51:22.5.1_0: When the Realized One submerges his body in his mind and his mind in his body. He meditates after sinking into a perception of bliss and lightness in the body.
ai-sn51:22.5.2_0: At that time his body easily rises up from the ground into the air.
ai-sn51:22.5.3_0: They wield the many kinds of psychic power: multiplying themselves and becoming one again ...
ai-sn51:22.5.3_1: he exercises power as far as the Brahma worlds with his body.
ai-sn51:22.6.1_0: Suppose there was a light tuft of cotton-wool or kapok. Taken up by the wind, it would easily rise up from the ground into the air.
ai-sn51:22.6.2_0: In the same way, sometimes the Realized One submerges his body in his mind and his mind in his body. He meditates after sinking into a perception of bliss and lightness in the body.
ai-sn51:22.6.3_0: At that time his body easily rises up from the ground into the air.
ai-sn51:22.6.4_0: They wield the many kinds of psychic power: multiplying themselves and becoming one again ...
ai-sn51:22.6.4_1: as far as the Brahmā worlds control.”
ai-sn51:23.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are these four bases of psychic power.
ai-sn51:23.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by four?
ai-sn51:23.1.3_0: It’s when a mendicant develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to enthusiasm, and active effort.
ai-sn51:23.1.4_0: He develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to energy ...
ai-sn51:23.1.7_0: These are the four bases of psychic power.
ai-sn51:23.1.8_0: It’s because of developing and cultivating these four bases of psychic power that a mendicant realizes the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. And they live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.”
ai-sn51:24.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are these four bases of psychic power.
ai-sn51:24.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by four?
ai-sn51:24.1.3_0: It’s when a mendicant develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to enthusiasm, and active effort.
ai-sn51:24.1.4_0: He develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to energy ...
ai-sn51:24.1.7_0: These are the four bases of psychic power.”
ai-sn51:25.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are these four bases of psychic power.
ai-sn51:25.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by four?
ai-sn51:25.1.3_0: It’s when a mendicant develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to enthusiasm, and active effort.
ai-sn51:25.1.4_0: He develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to energy ...
ai-sn51:25.1.7_0: These are the four bases of psychic power.
ai-sn51:25.1.8_0: Because of developing and cultivating these four bases of psychic power, one of two results can be expected:
ai-sn51:25.1.9_0: enlightenment in the present life, or if there’s something left over, non-return.”
ai-sn51:26.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are these four bases of psychic power.
ai-sn51:26.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by four?
ai-sn51:26.1.3_0: It’s when a mendicant develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to enthusiasm, and active effort.
ai-sn51:26.1.4_0: He develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to energy ...
ai-sn51:26.1.7_0: These are the four bases of psychic power.
ai-sn51:26.1.8_0: Because of developing and cultivating these four bases of psychic power, seven fruits and benefits can be expected.
ai-sn51:26.2.2_0: You attain enlightenment early on in this very life.
ai-sn51:26.2.3_0: If not, they attain enlightenment at the time of death.
ai-sn51:26.2.4_0: If not, they attain enlightenment at the time of death.
ai-sn51:26.2.4_1: If, with the ending of the five lower fetters, they’re extinguished between one life and the next ... they’re extinguished upon landing ... they’re extinguished without extra effort ... they’re extinguished with extra effort ... they head upstream, going to the Akaniṭṭha realm.
ai-sn51:26.2.5_0: Because of developing and cultivating these four bases of psychic power, these seven fruits and benefits can be expected.”
ai-sn51:26.2.6_0: The sixth offering to an individual.
ai-sn51:27.1.2_0: Then Venerable Ānanda went up to the Buddha,
ai-sn51:27.1.2_2: After the meal, on his return from alms-round, he went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and told him what had happened.
ai-sn51:27.2.1_0: “Sir, what is psychic power? What is the basis of psychic power? What is the development of the bases of psychic power? And what is the practice that leads to the development of the bases of psychic power?”
ai-sn51:27.2.2_0: “Ānanda, take a mendicant who wields the many kinds of psychic power: multiplying themselves and becoming one again ...
ai-sn51:27.2.2_1: By means of the Brahmā realm, saying,
ai-sn51:27.3.1_0: And what is the basis of psychic power?
ai-sn51:27.3.2_0: The path and practice that leads to gaining psychic power.
ai-sn51:27.3.3_0: This is called the basis of psychic power.
ai-sn51:27.4.1_0: And what is the development of the bases of psychic power?
ai-sn51:27.4.2_0: It’s when a mendicant develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to enthusiasm ...
ai-sn51:27.4.3_0: He develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to energy ...
ai-sn51:27.4.6_0: This is called the development of the bases of psychic power.
ai-sn51:27.5.1_0: And what is the practice that leads to the development of the bases of psychic power?
ai-sn51:27.5.4_0: This is called the practice that leads to the development of the bases of psychic power.”
ai-sn51:28.1.2_0: “Ānanda, what is psychic power? What is the basis of psychic power? What is the development of the bases of psychic power? And what is the practice that leads to the development of the bases of psychic power?”
ai-sn51:28.1.3_0: Sir, the Buddha has rooted in the teaching. He is our guide and our refuge. ...”

ai-sn51:31.1.3_0: What things has the mendicant Moggallāna developed and cultivated so as to have such power and might?”
ai-sn51:31.2.1_0: “Our teachings are rooted in the Buddha. He is our guide and our refuge. ...”
ai-sn51:31.2.2_0: “The mendicant Moggallāna has become so powerful and mighty by developing and cultivating the four bases of psychic power.
ai-sn51:31.3.2_0: Moggallāna develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to enthusiasm, and active effort.
ai-sn51:31.3.3_0: They think: ‘My enthusiasm won’t be too lax or too tense. And it’ll be neither constricted internally nor scattered externally.’
ai-sn51:31.3.5_0: as before, so after; as after, so before.
ai-sn51:31.3.6_0: as below, so above; as above, so below;
ai-sn51:31.3.7_0: as by day, so by night; as by night, so by day.
ai-sn51:31.3.8_0: And so, with an open and unenveloped heart, they develop a mind that’s full of radiance.
